metadata.title: CVE-2015-1030 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory leak in the rfc2553_connect_to function in jbsocket.c in Privoxybefore 3.0.22 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) via a large number of requests that are rejected because thesocket limit is reached.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1030` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

privoxy - 3.0.21-7+debu1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: privoxy package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.21-7+debu1build0.14.04.1').
